Seeing Gabrielle Giffords ' left eye flickering, her husband, Mark Kelly, started saying: Gabrielle Giffords , open your eyes, open your eyes, Kirsten Gillibrand said. After about 30 seconds, Gabrielle Giffords did just that. "You could tell she was desperately trying to focus, and it took enormous strength from her," Kirsten Gillibrand said.

suggestion of bankruptcy protection. California Treasurer Bill Lockyer told Reuters Insider on Monday that states may not need the same freedom to declare bankruptcy as major companies because they have a guaranteed source of revenue. The major difference, of course, is that we're looking at sovereign governments that have the ability to enact a tax, and that's not the case of these private corporations that may have unfunded obligations that they can't deal with, he said. The Insurance Institute for Highway Safety and others have questioned whetherbanning texting behind the wheel orusing a hand-held cell phone reduces traffic accidents. Ray LaHood responded Thursday by saying, there are some who would like to derail our work spotlighting the dangers of texting or talking on the phone while driving. I want them to know that our fight to end distracted driving will not be deterred. Ray LaHood has been on a self-described "rampage" on the issue in the wake of harrowing stories of motorists killed by drivers who were texting or talking on a phone.
